column4: http://www.cl.ly/0W3i461g3Q212O39060q this is from regular ubuntu install after the brown screen with icon on the bottom
yeah, its definatly your dell monitor
xD
the actuall error isnt on that screen
do you get the same problem with the alt livecd?
burning now hehe you on for 20 min more?
probbally all night, usueally in #ubuntu-offtopic 24/7
im not in the select language menu.. Should i just try to install?
yes, install with the alternate iso
Got a black screen
might need to give it a bit more time
Hehe.. still black :p
did it not do anything at all?
nope.. i just hit the option "install ubuntu"
reboot and try the command line install option
Expert mode? i cant see any commandline install
no thats not right
which iso did you download?
this one http://mirror.bytemark.co.uk/ubuntu-releases//11.04/ubuntu-11.04-alternate-i386.iso
correct right?
have you ever gotten a linux kernel to boot on this machine?
nope :S
its brand new..
AMD Athlon II X2 250
do you know what motherboard it has?
MSI 890FXA-GD65, Socket-AM3
tryed a disk with ubuntu installed on.. and tryed to enter recovery mode.. and got the same error that was on that image i sendt to you
im dl the alternate iso your using just a sec
do you have a spare USB drive around?
yeah
and a working ubuntu system I take it
hehe yeah
what kind of graphic card do you have?
Just 5850s
put your spare usb drive in and unmount anything that gets automounted
alright done

now sudo -s, and run this command replacing X with the letter of you usb drive (this will erase all data on your disk `wget -O /dev/sdX "http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/natty/main/installer-i386/current/images/netboot/mini.iso"`
in the mean time, on the boot options of the alternate install press fc and choose noacpi andacpi=off then boot with the install ubuntu command
f6 typo
how do you list drives again? :p
sudo blkid or sudo fdisk -l
done downloading
put that to the side for a minute and try booting the alternate iso with noacpi and acpi=off
Just black screen still just did it tho
try boting from that USB stick instead
makesure theres no CDs in the drive when you do
It just booted to the hd after selecting usb..
make sure your using a usb 2.0 port
the 3.0 are blue right?
couldnt say, you can paint anything any color
try a few different ports
But on this drive i have ubuntu and i booted into grub now and can edit the recovery .. should i give it a try?
you mean ubuntu is already installed on it?
Yeah.. but it might be corrupt.. it wont boot aswell :p
it wont boot? does it give that same error?
yeah
should i try another graphic card?

ok pop that usb drive back in the working ubuntu, unmount and try this `wget -O /dev/sdX "http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/natty/main/installer-amd64/current/images/netboot/mini.iso"` then boot from that, you are definatly having a hardware issue here maybe 64 bit will work better
does it really use 6 secs to download and make the usb bootable?
yes, 19MB
Alright.. so just run from disk or what?
oh.. it auto booted.. same error :P
in it now again.. just shot if you have ideas what i can try
try pressing pause during boot and see if you can get the first error message on the screen
how?
by pressing pause during boot
as in the pause button on the keyboard? :P ill try
yeah it does actually do something :)
install or run from usb?
anywhere it creates that message
can you run any OS on this machine?
Have not tryed windows.. just ubuntu and CentOS
centOS give that same error?
Something els about kernel panic
can you successfully run 'memcheck86"
Yeah
how did you install ubuntu on it to begin with?
another machine :P
try booting windows, if that doesnt work then id have to say your hardware is broken
bah.. hehe
got a video of the boot now.. sec
http://www.cl.ly/3J2Q32043e16360T1t19
Can i just get a hold of a windows iso and use the command you gave me to make it bootable on usb? :P
thats definatly a hardware issue, the kernel crashes right away
no that little trick with wget doesnt even work with most linux isos
What hardware do you think is wrong? :p
your CPU or FSB
yeah
alright.. ill try to swap mb.. but i just got 2 of the same tho..
What are the odds that its the CPU rather than MB? both are brand new like 5 days old
pretty good, CPUs are so sensitive to everything
bah :p
How can i have 2 CPUs that are not working.. *facepalm*
you have 2 cpus in the machine? you could try testing them seperately
no in another machine:p
